intro: Guettarda tenuiramis, commonly known as the slender guettarda, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Guettarda tenuiramis is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline environments.
